## ü©ª Overview

Lung cancer remains among the most lethal malignancies ‚Äî only about **one in four patients** survive five years.
For those with **locally advanced Stage III NSCLC**, radiotherapy (RT) is a primary treatment, yet cardiac exposure during RT may silently shape survival outcomes.

This project analyzes how **spatial dose distribution** to the heart correlates with **2-year overall survival (OS)**.
Using **voxel-wise statistical modeling**, **unsupervised clustering**, and **advanced visualization**, we identify cardiac regions whose radiation dose patterns most strongly associate with patient outcomes.

---

## ‚ö†Ô∏è Research Challenge

Radiotherapy aims to
‚Äì **maximize dose** to tumor tissue,
‚Äì **minimize dose** to healthy organs.

However, even small incidental doses to the **heart and major vessels** can increase mortality risk.
Our working hypothesis: *specific cardiac subregions receiving higher dose may correlate with lower OS.*

---

## üß¨ Dataset

- **Institution:** IRCCS Istituto Nazionale dei Tumori di Milano
- **Patients:** 321 across 5 centers
- **Modalities:** DICOM CT scans + RT dose maps
- **Outcome:** 2-year overall survival
- **Features:** 54 clinical and treatment variables

::: {.details title="Feature Groups"}
- **Anatomic / Metabolic:** age, BMI, hypertension, KPS, smoking
- **Cancer-Related:** stage, tumor size, site, mutations
- **Therapy:** chemotherapy cycles, immunotherapy, machine type, EQD2 dose
- **Outcomes:** cardiac and pulmonary events, 2-year OS
:::

---

## ‚öôÔ∏è Feature Engineering & Preprocessing

- **Medication count:** grouped as 0 / 1 / 2 / >3 classes
- **Therapy types:** combined target + immunotherapy into one variable
- **Smoking:** binary encoded
- **Performance status (KPS):** binned (‚â§80, 90, 100)
- **Chemotherapy schedule:** rescaled so 0 = no therapy

---

## üß™ Statistical Methods

- Welch‚Äôs t-test (voxel-wise analysis)
- Benjamini‚ÄìHochberg FDR correction
- PCA + DBSCAN for outlier detection
- Mean-dose voxel mapping

---

## üß† Methodology

1. **Preprocess CT + dose data** into voxel grids.
2. **Spatial registration** ‚Üí map each patient onto a shared template.
3. **Voxel-Based Analysis (VBA)** ‚Üí compare dose voxels between survivors vs non-survivors.
4. **Unsupervised clustering** ‚Üí detect spatial patterns of significance.
5. **Visualization** ‚Üí render p-value and dose maps for interpretation.

## üîç Findings

- Survivors ‚Üí more **focused, precise dose distributions** in cardiac voxels.
- Non-survivors ‚Üí **broader exposure** and less localized energy deposition.
- No single heart substructure fully explains the effect; patterns are spatially distributed.
- Proper template alignment and EQD‚ÇÇ correction are critical for reliable statistics.

---

## üöÄ Goals & Implications

- Clarify mechanisms of **radiation-induced cardiac toxicity**.
- Identify **spatial biomarkers** linked to survival.
- Support more **personalized radiotherapy planning** by mapping risk regions within the heart.
